016package edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.viewmodel;
017
018import android.content.Context;
019import android.content.SharedPreferences;
020import androidx.lifecycle.DefaultLifecycleObserver;
021import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
022import androidx.lifecycle.Transformations;
023import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel;
024import dagger.hilt.android.lifecycle.HiltViewModel;
025import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
026import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.R;
027import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.service.PreferencesRepository;
028import javax.inject.Inject;
029import kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1;
030
031/**
032 * Provides access (for a UI controller or data-bound view) to some subset of the current
033 * preferences state. While {@link PreferencesRepository} provides access to the full
034 * {@link android.content.SharedPreferences} of the app, this class takes the approach of using
035 * {@link Transformations#map(LiveData, Function1)} to provide {@link LiveData}-based read-only
036 * access to individual preference values. This approach is of most use when an instance of a
037 * {@link androidx.preference.PreferenceFragmentCompat} subclass is used to modify
038 * {@link android.content.SharedPreferences}, and the preference values need to be used (but not
039 * modified) in other UI controllers.
040 */
041@HiltViewModel
042public class PreferencesViewModel extends ViewModel implements DefaultLifecycleObserver {
043
044  private final LiveData<Boolean> selectableTextPreference;
045
046  // TODO Declare additional LiveData fields for individual preferences as necessary.
047
048  @Inject
049  PreferencesViewModel(@ApplicationContext Context context, PreferencesRepository repository) {
050    LiveData<SharedPreferences> prefs = repository.getPreferences();
051    selectableTextPreference = selectableTextPreferenceLiveData(context, prefs);
052    // TODO Initialize additional LiveData fields (as needed) for other individual preferences.
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Returns {@link LiveData} containing the current value of the selectable text preference,
057   * presumably for observation by a UI controller or bound {@link android.view.View}.
058   */
059  public LiveData<Boolean> getSelectableTextPreference() {
060    return selectableTextPreference;
061  }
062
063  private LiveData<Boolean> selectableTextPreferenceLiveData(Context context,
064      LiveData<SharedPreferences> preferences) {
065    String selectableTextPrefKey = context.getString(R.string.selectable_text_pref_key);
066    boolean selectableTextPrefDefault = context
067        .getResources()
068        .getBoolean(R.bool.selectable_text_pref_default);
069    return Transformations.map(preferences,
070        (prefs) -> prefs.getBoolean(selectableTextPrefKey, selectableTextPrefDefault));
071  }
072
073  // TODO Following the example of the selectableTextPreferenceLiveData method, define additional
074  //  methods (as needed) to initialize LiveData fields for other individual preferences.
075
076}
